posts.post_content:
Lateralis0ne,
  
   
First off, assuming my age before forming a proper argument shows me that you're clearly younger than I am. Secondly, you don't actually FORM a proper argument. You speak of balance, then, and I quote, call the card, "crazy-powerful." There is no balance when certain colors gain cards on incredible, unbalanced strength. Look at Jace. Look at Stoneforge. The developers of Magic banned those cards because they powered up cards far too much and released them into the public without realizing the consequences. Here is a quote from MTG's R&D on the topic of overpowered cards:
  
   
"Everyone agrees that innovation is a Very Good Thing and thus we should be constantly pushing the envelope. Well, if we're constantly pushing the envelope and striving to come up with cool new weird and wacky cards, then occasionally we're going to make a mistake." - Randy Buehler
  
   
Cards like this are not only a problem for non-black players, but for everyone. People defending this card make a va... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Just my two cents...  
Make it a 10/10 for 13 colorless, remove trample and make it an eldrazi named Emrakul's/Zendikar's Obliterator. It would fit better and not come out so fast it just ends the game. The issue is not that this ability is too powerful (well it is on turn 4) it's just that it comes out way too fast.  
And is green not the creature color?   
Another idea. GGGG 5/5 trample. Whenever Viridian Obliterator takes damage from a non-creature source you may have it deal that much damage distributed among any amount of creatures/players or we it could have have target player sacrifice that many permanents  
...Even that is pretty much shroud. Hell with it. make it  
GGGGGG  
This but 6/6 (waay to good but I play green. ;)

Posted By: Lord_of_the_Real (3/21/2012 11:52:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In Multiplayer, this card is a little more fair. A little.  
I've got one and I've only made my opponents sacrifice a few permanents in multi at most, and that's when I attack the players with worse board positions.  
It really shines in single player if you can get it out lategame though.  
  
The flavor is nice: Black makes people sacrifice, and [Sheoldred, Whispering One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sheoldred, Whispering One) has improved on [Phyrexian Negator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Negator) in New Phyrexia to the point where it's *almost* broken.  
  
Absolutely *eats* [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares), [Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat), [Beast Within](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Beast Within), [Wrack with Madness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrack with Madness), [Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak), and [Dismember](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dismember). There, I listed six cards in all colors (and colorless!) in Standard that can deal with this for three or less mana (except red; sorry red.)   
  
If you face Black or Blue/Black Standard decks, be prepared to face the Obliterator, or all life sha... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
In Multiplayer, this card is a little more fair. A little.
I've got one and I've only made my opponents sacrifice a few permanents in multi at most, and that's when I attack the players with worse board positions.
It really shines in single player if you can get it out lategame though.

The flavor is nice: Black makes people sacrifice, and Sheoldred, Whispering One has improved on Phyrexian Negator in New Phyrexia to the point where it's almost broken.

Absolutely eats Swords to Plowshares, Go for the Throat, Beast Within, Wrack with Madness, Mana Leak, and Dismember. There, I listed six cards in all colors (and colorless!) in Standard that can deal with this for three or less mana (except red; sorry red.)

If you face Black or Blue/Black Standard decks, be prepared to face the Obliterator, or all life sha... (see all)

posts.post_content: OK...yeah...even when time spiral came out I'd have stared at this and just kind of wondered who let R&D get ahold of acid, moonshine, and absinthe in a 15 minute time span but...I mean, come on while it is an extremely powerful creature, flavor-wise Yawgmoth would've given his left testicle for one of these during the Dominarian invasion, just ONE and this thing isn't legendary so I have to assume following what I can remember from the novels (when I read them all those years ago) these things would travel in groups of two plus underlings. How is anything short of a force of pre-mending planeswalkers supposed to fight a full invasion force of Mirrodin phyrexians? I mean there are supposed to still be a few survivors right?
